title: Thomas Stone National Historic Site: NPS Centennial
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     NPS Centennial            NPS Centennial       The National Park Service turns 100 on August 25, 2016. As we lead up to the centennial, we invite you to participate in Find Your Park Experiences to learn, discover, be inspired, or simply have fun in national parks. Find Your Park Experiences offer unique opportunities to explore national parks both in person and online. Check out the experiences in this park or search all experiences to identify an opportunity that matches your interests. You can also share your national park story at FindYourPark.com. A Call to Action remains the foundation for our 2016 centennial preparations. It is the National Park Service's blueprint for the future, outlining the innovative work we want to accomplish. Thomas Stone National Historic Site is a big part of this effort. Take a look at what we're doing and get involved!   Experiences      Geocaching the Captain John Smith Chesapeake Trail  Come on a geocaching adventure to remember and commemorate the history and travels of Captain John Smith! Read more      Call to Action Projects      Stone Family Sideboard Returns  Through a grant and an excellent historic preservationist, a piece of history returned to the park.  Read more   "Starry Night"  On May 3rd, Thomas Stone National Historic Site was please to host approximately 120 visitors who came to enjoy a safe method of sun viewing followed after dark by some amazing star gazing, free from the dilution of city lights. Read more   "Echoes of Liberty" at Signer of Declaration's House  The exhibit traces the ideal of “liberty” throughout history and through time.  Read more   Concert on the Porch  Music once again reveberated from the home of Thomas Stone, a Signer of the Declaration of Independence.  Read more   Uncovering the Past at Thomas Stone NHS  Making accessible archives online and learning about our shared history in the process.  Read more   A Call to Action Projects for Thomas Stone National Historic Site       2016 Centennial Plan for Thomas Stone NHS and George Washington Birthplace NM
